column4: I believe you'll need to reinstall GRUB. A grub-update would do the trick. I think you'll first have to run ubuntu from a live CD. Check this for reference http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=10479319&postcount=5http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=10479319&postcount=5
i am on Live CD i try that link thanks a lot
I'm trying to modify the Boomerang theme and would want to make the tabs in the  gnome-terminal upside down. Is this possible? I can not get the border-bottom to show up. Any help with  this?
so i try it but it doesnt help can i just delete some partion with GRUB i just need to start windows dont need data
Try to load windows in repair mode from the Windows installation disk. I believe your MBR is deleted so start the Repair and in the command prompt type bootrec /fixmbr and then bootrec /fixboot
should i skip GRUB when i delete some partion on HDD ?
What do you mean by skipping GRUB?
i just need to start windows to restore computer so i need to skip GRUB
dont have instalation disk i had windows installed on PC before i bought it
what actually happend when you tried to reinstall grub and run a grub-update?
cant mount any sda i had ubuntu on sda4 but after restart is gone and cant mount other sda's
Why not just install ubuntu on sda4 again?

you dont understand me i will tell you it chronologically. I wanted to reset windows. I found VAIO assist tool to reset notebook to defeault factory settings. I save all my data and can delete all things on notebook. I click that button to reset it. Notebook is restarting, when turned off and tried to start GRUB rescue promt prevented to start windows so cant finish that operation. I  found out on Live CD that my ubuntu is
i will install ubuntu later but need to clear windows
my only problem is GRUB so i am asking that is it possible to skip GRUB when i delete Linux swap partion
I'm not aware of such a possibility
Do you want to keep Windows or want to delete it completely
If you want to remove Windows for good just install ubunt and format all the other partitions afterwards
had a Disconnect when u wrote something

I don't think you can just skip GRUB. Maybe someone else might have a solution for this but I believe your Windows MBR is wiped out or something. I'm not sure what this reset actually did but it seems it f**ked up GRUB in some way. The only solution I see is to install ubuntu on sda4. If it already is on sda4 and grub loads from there try to mount sda4 and reset GRUB.
Sorry if I'm not getting the picture here.
thanks a lot
you're welcome
